thread.title: Windjammer girls remain unbeaten, Panther boys salvage tie
thread.title_full: Windjammer girls remain unbeaten, Panther boys salvage tie

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Windjammer girls remain unbeaten, Panther boys salvage tie
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Windjammer girls remain unbeaten, Panther boys salvage tie Oceanside boys, Medomak Valley girls downed in Oct. 6 contests By Staff | Oct 07, 2015 
Oceanside, Camden Hills and Medomak Valley had high school soccer squads in action on the pitch Tuesday, Oct. 6, a scenario that saw the four participating area squads experience different results. 
The Windjammer girls posted a win over Mount Blue of Farmington, while the Mariner boys were dealt a loss in overtime by Winslow. 
The Panther boys salvaged a tie with Leavitt of Turner, while the MVHS girls were stung by the Hornets. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Girls soccer 
Camden Hills 3, Mount Blue 2 
At Farmington Oct. 6, the Windjammers remained unbeaten as they rallied from an early 1-0 deficit to clinch their ninth win. The squads were tied 1-1 at halftime. 
Eliza Roy scored two goals for Camden Hills and Emma Gutheinz one, while Bryn Anderson also logged an assist. 
Eryn Doiron scored both goals for Mount Blue. 
Jana Spieker made four saves on eight shots for the Windjammers, which attempted 16 shots in the win. 
Doiron scored the first goal off a direct kick, but Roy responded with 12 minutes left in the first half when her shot hit the post and nestled in behind the Cougar keeper. 
Gutheinz then put the Windjammers on top when she creased the net, off an assist from Anderson, while Roy added an insurance goal later in the half. 
Camden Hills coach Meredith Messer said Doiron brought the Cougars within one goal with time winding down and “put the pressure on for the remainder of the game including a shot with two seconds left that hit the side netting.” 
"It is starting to register with the girls that every team wants to beat them badly,” said the veteran coach. “We passed and possessed well in the first half, but didn't play with our usual tenacity. We are learning how to put all the necessary components together for a whole game. We have three weeks left [our playoff game being on Oct. 27], so we have plenty of time to keep practicing and getting better." 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class A North, Camden Hills (10-0-1, 107.8571 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Boys soccer 
Medomak Valley 1, Leavitt 1 (2 OT) 
At Waldoboro Oct. 6, the Panthers and Hornets battled to a stalemate after two 40-minute halves and two five-minute overtimes. 
Adam Eutsler scored with 14:34 left in the first half, off a throw by Nicholas DePatsy, while Joe Baumann scored for Leavitt with 36:50 remaining in the half. 
Medomak Valley held a 15-6 edge in shots. Cameron Robinson made five saves in goal for Medomak Valley, while Lucas Perry made eight saves in net for Leavitt. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (6-2-2, 53.3163 points) is fifth, while Ellsworth (9-0-1, 85.4847 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Winslow 2, Oceanside 1 (2 OT) 
At Winslow Oct. 6, the Black Raiders creased the net in overtime as they dealt the Mariners their second loss of the year. Oceanside led 1-0 at halftime. 
Christian Straka scored for the Mariners, while Isaac Lambrecht and Jake Wren scored for the Black Raiders, with Wren's goal being the difference in OT. 
Coby Dorr played in goal for Oceanside and Jake Lapierre for Winslow. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (6-2-2, 65.4337 points) is third, while Ellsworth (9-0-1, 85.4847 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
